intro: Scabiosa cosmoides, commonly known as the Cosmo Scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Scabiosa cosmoides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
